intro: Lastrea dichrotrichoides, commonly known as the two-colored hairgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop in clusters. It is often found in dune ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes through its extensive root system. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important component of coastal vegetation in its native habitat.
